metadata.title: "Coyote's Journey"
metadata.author: Mamie Offield
metadata.publication: William Bright, The Karok Language (1957), pp. 190-193, Text 5

s.txt:
pihnêefich
u xus , "
tîi
kahyúras
kan vâaram i ,
ishpúk
kan ikyáan ."
s.trans: Coyote thought, "Let me go to Klamath Lakes, let me go get money."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u vâaram .
s.trans: So he went off.

s.txt:
kári
xás
tá
yíiv
u 'uum .
s.trans: And he went a long ways.

s.txt:
kári
xás
káan
u máh
akvaat ,
ípaha
kun 'irukûuntakoo .
s.trans: And there he saw raccoons, they were sitting in a tree.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
tîi
yíth
kan píkyav
pa naní shaanva ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me get a different suit of clothes."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u pititítit
pa mú saanva ,
xás
sáruk
u xyáfak oo .
s.trans: So he tore up his clothes, and he threw them downhill.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kúniihka
píshiip
yítha .
s.trans: And he shot at the first one.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u p ishkákunih .
s.trans: And it jumped down.

s.txt:
kúkuum
vúra
yíth
u kúniihka .
s.trans: Again he shot at another.

s.txt:
kúkuum
vúra
u p ishkákunih .
s.trans: Again it jumped down.

s.txt:
chavúra
koovúra
kun p ikakúniih va .
s.trans: Finally they all jumped down.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u p ífik
pa mú saanva .
s.trans: And he picked up his clothes.

s.txt:
xás
u piptákith .
s.trans: And he mended them.

s.txt:
áhup
u p vêehruprih .
s.trans: He stuck twigs through them.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u pasasîip .
s.trans: And he dressed.

s.txt:
xás
u 'ípahoo .
s.trans: And he went on.

s.txt:
kári
xás
tá
yíiv
u 'uum .
s.trans: Then he went a long ways.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u mah ,
yánava
ôok
u 'iinvá hi tih .
s.trans: And he saw it, he saw there was a forest fire here.

s.txt:
yánava
vúra
uum
taay ,
pa xath ímtup .
s.trans: He saw there were lots of roasted grasshoppers.

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
naa
pu kin 'áv eesh ara .
s.trans: And he said, "I won't eat you.

s.txt:
kahyúras
ni vâaramu tih ,
ishpúk
ni kyâan tih ."
s.trans: I'm going to Klamath Lakes, I'm going to get money."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan 'ám
yítha ."
s.trans: Then he thought, "Let me eat one."

s.txt:
xás
vúra
taay
u 'av .
s.trans: So he ate a whole lot.

s.txt:
vúra
pu yâavahi tih .
s.trans: He couldn't get full.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
hûut
kumá'ii
pa pu na yâavahi tih ara ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Why am I not getting full?"

s.txt:
hínupa
áfup
kun pávyiihrishuk ti
p oo 'áam tih .
s.trans: There they were coming out of his buttocks as he ate.

s.txt:
xás
axváha
u p ishnápchak .
s.trans: So he plugged it up with pitch.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u yâavaha .
s.trans: Then he got full.

s.txt:
chími
vaa
u 'íinka
pa 'axváha
pa mu 'áfup .
s.trans: Soon the pitch was burning on his buttocks.

s.txt:
xás
áas
ú skaakurih .
s.trans: So he jumped into water.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ípahoo .
s.trans: Then he went on.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u mah ,
yánava
u tháthriinaa
axraat .
s.trans: Then he saw it, he saw bowls of gooseberries sitting.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
naa
kahyúras
ni vâaramu tih ,
ishpúk
ni kyâan tih .
s.trans: And he said, "I'm going to Klamath Lakes, I'm going to get money.

s.txt: pu na 'áv eesh ara ."
s.trans: I won't eat them."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan pakatkâat i ."
s.trans: Then he thought, "Let me taste them."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
vúra
u chafipáyaachha .
s.trans: So he ate them all up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip ,
achiimuuch pihnîich , "
akâay
t u tháfip
naní xraat .
s.trans: Then Old Man Lizard said, "Who ate up my gooseberries?

s.txt:
kíri
chími
áas
u xráh eesh ."
s.trans: Let him get thirsty!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
vúra
vaa
u 'áhoo
pihnêefich .
s.trans: And so Coyote traveled.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
íshaha
tá
née xrah ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I'm thirsty."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u thítiv ,
áas
u vúun tih .
s.trans: And he heard it, water flowing.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kúkurih .
s.trans: And he stooped down to it.

s.txt:
ámtaap
kích
u kpúpusip .
s.trans: Just dust puffed up.

s.txt:
púyava
kári
xás
u 'áhoo .
s.trans: So he traveled.

s.txt:
"
payêem
vúra
yiimúsich
vúra
ni kvíripshipree vish ,"
u xus .
s.trans: "Now I'll break into a run just close to it," he thought.

s.txt:
kári
xás
áas
u thítiv .
s.trans: And he heard water.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kúkurih .
s.trans: And he stooped down to it.

s.txt:
ámtaap
xás
u kpúpusip .
s.trans: And dust puffed up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ípahoo .
s.trans: So he went on.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xus , "
payêem
nani kútrahar
ni paathkúrih eesh ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Now I'll throw my coat in the water."

s.txt:
kári
xás
pá 'aas
u thítiv .
s.trans: Then he heard the water.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kvíripship .
s.trans: And he broke into a run.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u paathkúri
pa mu kutraahtíhan .
s.trans: And he threw his coat in the water.

s.txt:
ámtaap
xás
u kpúpusip .
s.trans: And dust puffed up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ípahoo ,
vúra
t óo
xrah .
s.trans: So he went on, he was really thirsty.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kahyúras
u 'uum .
s.trans: Then he arrived at Klamath Lakes.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u kúkurih .
s.trans: And he stooped down to the water.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ish .
s.trans: And he drank.

s.txt:
xás
u máthapha ,
kári
xás
ú kyiimkurih .
s.trans: And he became too heavy, and he fell in.

s.txt:
xás
u síinvar .
s.trans: And he drowned.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u p thívruuhvarak .
s.trans: So he floated back down from upriver.

s.txt:
kári
xás
t u teeníhaha .
s.trans: And there was a freshet.

s.txt:
"
ahup yâamach
vúra
ni párihishrih ."
s.trans: (He said), "Let me turn into a pretty stick."

s.txt:
kári
xás
tá
kun taxvuk rípan
pa 'áhup
pa 'ifápiit ich as .
s.trans: And the young girls were hooking out the wood.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun mah ,
t u thívruuhvarak
pa 'ahup yâamach .
s.trans: And they saw it, the pretty stick floated down from upriver.

s.txt:
xás
koovúra
tá
kun piip , "
naa
uum
ni táxvuukripaa vish ."
s.trans: And they all said, "I'm going to hook it out."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun táxvuukripaa .
s.trans: And they hooked it out.

s.txt:
chí va
koovúra
kun ímuutara hi naa
pa 'ifápiit ich as .
s.trans: Soon all the young girls were pregnant.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u 'ípahoo
pihnêefich .
s.trans: So Coyote went on.

s.txt:
áraar
t óo
párihish ,
uum
vúra
t óo
párihish .
s.trans: He turned back into a person, he turned back into himself.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u mah ,
yána
ôok
páy
kun 'íhuk vunaa tih .
s.trans: And he saw it, he saw they were flower-dancing right here.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u 'ihukûum aheen .
s.trans: So he flower-danced.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u 'êeth varayva
pa yêeriphar .
s.trans: And he carried around the pubescent girl.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ú muutara ha .
s.trans: And she became pregnant.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ú kvip
pihnêefich .
s.trans: Then Coyote ran (away).

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun 'áharam ,
kun piip , "
vaa
pá vaa
kupavêenah an ."
s.trans: Then they chased him, they said, "That's the one who did that mischief."

s.txt:
kári
xás
ú kvip .
s.trans: And he ran.

s.txt:
chími
kun ipáhariithun eesh .
s.trans: They were about to catch up with him.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ahváraa k
u píshtaaxva ,
u piip , "
kíi vyiihrishuk i ,
kíi vyiihrishuk i ."
s.trans: So he pulled back his foreskin in a hollow tree, he said, "Come out, come out!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
asvúut
kun ívyiihrishuk ,
kun kitaxríh ahi tih .
s.trans: And ants came out, they had wings.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
kun ípeen tih "
pihneefpíshtaaxva ."
s.trans: That's what they call "Coyote pulling-back-foreskin."
s.note: Acute accent in víri obscured in published text, but it appears to be a printing error as there are two traces of it left. Acute accent is expected there.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun 'iruveehíshriih va
pa 'îin
kun 'áharamu tih ,
kun ímuus tih ,
kun piip , "
fâatkook ."
s.trans: And those who were chasing him stopped, they looked, they said, "What is it?"

s.txt:
xás
pihnêefich
uum
ta
yiiv .
s.trans: And by this time Coyote was a long ways off.
s.note: Notice the lack of accent on ta; is it because yiiv lacks accent?

s.txt:
kári
xás
kúkuum
chími
kun ipáhariithun eesh .
s.trans: Then they were about to catch up with him again.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ahváraa k
u thúrivkaa .
s.trans: So he urinated on a hollow tree.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun ívyiihrishuk ,
kun ixipríshuk va
p áachviiv .
s.trans: And they came out, birds flew out.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun 'iruveehíshriih va ,
kun ímuus tih ,
kun piip , "
fâatkook ."
s.trans: Then (the pursuers) stopped, they looked, they said, "What is it?"

s.txt:
vaa
pa kun ípeen ti "
pihneefchúnivach ."
s.trans: That's what they call "little Coyote-urine" (Astragalinus sp.)

s.txt:
kári
xás
thúfip
mu máruk
t óo
kvíripvarak .
s.trans: Then he ran down from upriver, to a place uphill from Requa.

s.txt:
kári
xás
vaa
káan
tuyshiprée kaam
ú krii .
s.trans: And a big mountain sat there.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
ip nîinamich p i ,
ip nîinamich p i ."
s.trans: And he said, "Get little, get little!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
ápap kam
u kvíripunih .
s.trans: Then he ran down the other side.

s.txt:
kári
xás
iinâak
u vôonfuruk
ikmaháchraam .
s.trans: Then he crawled into a sweathouse.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun ihmáravarak
pa 'îin
kun 'áharamu tih .
s.trans: And the ones chasing him ran down from upriver.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun itfúnuk va
p eekmaháchraam .
s.trans: And they looked into the sweathouse.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
hôoy
kích
i máh een
áraar ."
s.trans: And they said, "Where did you see a person?"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u píip
pihnêefich , "
élekw' ."
s.trans: And Coyote said, "élekw'."
s.note: Bright: élekw' is "Yurok for 'I don't know' as pronounced by the informant. Coyote is pretending to be a Yurok."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
naa
ni xú ti '
u pí ti "
tá
yúruk heen ."'"
s.trans: And they said, "I think he says he's already downriver."

s.txt:
kári
xás
pihnêefich
u 'árihrupuk .
s.trans: Then Coyote jumped out.

s.txt:
kári
xás
sâam
u kvíripunih .
s.trans: And he ran downhill.

s.txt:
páah ak
ú skaakramnih ,
xás
ithyáruk
u víitkar .
s.trans: He jumped into a boat, and he paddled across-river.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
síit
kii vyíhuk i .
s.trans: Then he said, "Mice, come here!

s.txt:
kiik thárupriin i
pá paah ."
s.trans: Gnaw holes in the boats!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun thárupriin
pá paah .
s.trans: And they gnawed holes in the boat.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun píip
pa 'îin
kun 'áharamu tih , "
naa
ni p êesh '
vaa
pa 'ípa
ikmaháchraam
kú kree n hat .'"
s.trans: Then the ones chasing him said, "I'll bet that was him who was in the sweathouse."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun píhmaravrin .
s.trans: So they ran back the opposite direction.

s.txt:
yánava
ithyarukiráastiip
xás
ú krii .
s.trans: They saw them he was on the opposite shore.

s.txt:
kári
xás
pá paah
pa kun p ûukar .
s.trans: And they put out the boats.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u 'arankúrih een ,
ayâach
pá siit
tá
kun thárupriin .
s.trans: But they sank, because the mice had gnawed holes in them.
s.note: The first vowel in ayâach is not expected to be short, but there is no evidence it is a typo. The last vowel in kunthárupriin is not expected to be long. Most likely it is a plural action allomorph. The suffix -ruprin is not supposed to lengthen in the presence of plural action (and the -va is not supposed to disappear), but if the suffix is actually just -rin ('hither across water,' but also with a meaning of 'through') then in plural action it should lengthen and the va should disappear.

s.txt:
kári
xás
pihnêefich
ikrívraam
u mah ,
yána
u 'íikra .
s.trans: Then Coyote saw a house, he saw it standing.

s.txt:
xás
u vôonfuruk .
s.trans: So he crawled inside.

s.txt:
yánava
vúra
uum
taay ,
pa 'athkurit patúmkir .
s.trans: He saw there were lots of grease pillows.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u thafípkaanva ,
vúra
t u xuniháyaachha .
s.trans: And he ate them all up, he was really hungry.

s.txt:
kári
xás
á'
u vôoruraa
iyvôoruraa k .
s.trans: Then he crawled up on the woodpile.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ú kviit-ha .
s.trans: And he fell asleep.

s.txt:
kári
xás
tée
kxurar ,
kári
xás
u thítiv ,
kun chúuphi tih .
s.trans: By now it was evening, and he heard them, they were talking.
s.note: Coalescence of ta + ikxurar, giving tée kxurar. This is not a coalesence of ta + 2nd sg. sbj i-.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u tvûunih .
s.trans: And he looked down.

s.txt:
yánava
astaah .
s.trans: He saw they were ducks.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
húuka
nanu patúmkir .
s.trans: And they said, "Where are our pillows?

s.txt:
chími
man ,
xâatik
fúum
ôok
nu p ikvêesh ."
s.trans: Well, let's not camp here."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun íthvuy
pa 'úkraam ,
yítha
káru
uum
u pí tih , "
vaa
kuma 'úkraam
ni p ikvêeshrih eesh ."
s.trans: And they named the ponds, and (each) one said, "I will camp at that pond."

s.txt:
kári
xás
yítha
u piip , "
naa
uknamxánahich
ni p ikvêeshrih eesh ."
s.trans: Then one said, "I will camp at uknamxánahich."

s.txt:
púyava
kári
xás
u 'árihrishuk
pihnêefich .
s.trans: Then Coyote jumped out.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
chími
kan ip thívkee ."
s.trans: And he said, "Let me go along!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
pûuhara .
s.trans: And they said, "No!

s.txt:
káruma
t i tháfip aheen
pa nanu patúmkir ."
s.trans: You ate up our pillows!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u piip , "
miník
kiik p ákih eesh
pa mikun patúmkir ,
chími
kan ip thívkee ."
s.trans: And he said, "I'll give you back your pillows, let me go along!"
s.note: Unexpected lack of inverse -ap on kiikpákiheesh.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
chími
man ."
s.trans: So they said, "All right."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun ipêer "
vúra
ík
i 'asímchaak tih eesh .
s.trans: And they told him, "You must keep your eyes closed.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ík
vúra
i túraayv eesh
pa nú peer ahaak ."
s.trans: Then when we tell you, you can look around."

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun íp viitship .
s.trans: So they started to paddle.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
uum
xára
tá
kun íp vit .
s.trans: And they paddled for a long time.

s.txt:
xás
u xus , "
tîi
kan itníshuk v i ."
s.trans: And (Coyote) thought, "Let me look out!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
vaa
káan
xás
u tníshuk va
tée
p
u 'aramsîiprih varak .
s.trans: And when he looked out there, he had already come down from upriver.
s.note: The Bright footnote discussing u'aramsîiprihvarak was erroneously printed as a footnote to the previous sentence. As it deals with a word in this sentence, I made it a footnote to this sentence.

Bright: "u'aramsîiprihvarak 'he started down from upriver' seems to indicate that áramsip(riv) 'to start out' has an irregular alternant ending in -rih- when it is followed by a directional suffix. There is no other evidence to support this, however. This form also presents the rare situation of two directional suffixes, =sip(riv) 'up, initiative' and -varak 'down from upriver,' occurring in sequence. This anomaly can be eliminated by considering áramsip(riv) as a single morpheme, an analysis supported by its irregular internal structure."

s.txt:
xás
kun piip , "
chími
nu pávyiihship ."
s.trans: Then they said, "Let's leave again."

s.txt:
xás
u piip , "
xâatik
ni p thívkee .
s.trans: And (Coyote) said, "Let me go along!

s.txt:
miník
kii kxúrik eesh ap ,
yâamach
kii kyâa vish ap ."
s.trans: I'll paint you, I'll make you pretty!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun piip , "
chími
man .
s.trans: So they said, "All right.

s.txt:
payêem
ík
vúra
i 'asímchaak tih eesh .
s.trans: This time you must keep your eyes closed.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ík
vúra
i túraayv eesh
pa nú peer ahaak ."
s.trans: Then when we tell you, you can look around."

s.txt:
kári
xás
vúra
kun íp viitraa .
s.trans: So they paddled upriver again.

s.txt:
púyava
uknamxánahich
tá
kun p ípasma ,
kári
xás
kun ipêer "
chími
túraayv i ."
s.trans: Then they brought him to uknamxánahich, and they told him, "Look around!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
p oo túraayva
kári
u piip , "
nani shívshaaneen ."
s.trans: And when he looked around, then he said, "My country!"

s.txt:
xás
úuth
u piytúykaan va
pá yuux ,
uknamxánahich
mú 'uuthkam ,
víri
vaa
kumá'ii
pa kêech
u sirishkíra hi tih .
s.trans: And he kicked the dirt out in the river, out from uknamxánahich, that's why there's a big bar (there).
s.note: I am unsure about which pa- is on kêech. Nominalizing pa- seems to occur after kumá'ii regularly, but Bright writes the initial consonant of kêech in this sentence as geminated and the nominalizing pa- should not trigger that gemination, only the determiner pa-.

s.txt:
kóova
pihnêefich
u 'aachíchh anik
pa t u 'ípak .
kupánakanakana .
s.trans: Coyote was so happy when he got back. kupánakanakana.
